alert.note: Alert for Banner; Cheyenne; Kimball (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Cheyenne (Southeastern Wyoming and Western Nebraska)
info.headline: Blizzard Warning issued December 25 at 3:53PM CST until December 27 at 6:00AM CST by NWS Cheyenne
info.description: ...BLIZZARD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 5 AM MST WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...Blizzard conditions expected. Total snow accumulations of 3 to 7 inches, with higher amounts of 8 to 12 inches possible along the Cheyenne Ridge. Winds gusting as high as 60 mph. * WHERE...In Wyoming, eastern Laramie County including Interstate 80 east of Mile Marker 380. In western Nebraska, Banner, Kimball, and Cheyenne Counties. This includes Burns, Carpenter, Pine Bluffs, Albin, Kimball, and Sidney. * WHEN...Until 5 AM MST Wednesday. The worst conditions are expected overnight into Tuesday morning. * IMPACTS...Extremely dangerous or impossible travel conditions due to icy, snow packed roads and near-zero visibilities in falling and blowing snow. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Expect rapidly worsening conditions immediately to the north and east of the city of Cheyenne.
info.instruction: Travel should be restricted to emergencies only. If you must travel, have a winter survival kit with you. If you get stranded, stay with your vehicle. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
